summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan requesting an in camera conference to discuss procedures for filing a Renewed Motion for Release on Bail under seal. The letter argues that the motion contains sensitive private information about sureties, financial records, and confidential discovery materials that would cause harm if made public.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, seeking renewed bail. The document discusses her detention, financial condition, and the harassment faced by her associates.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this letter is addressed regarding bail procedures.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, co-signer of this letter.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, co-signer of this letter.

connections.description: Mark S. Cohen is an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Christian R. Everdell is an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Both are partners at Cohen & Gresser LLP and are co-representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Request for In Camera Conference on Bail Motion
events.description: Defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell file a letter requesting a sealed, in camera conference to discuss procedures for filing a Renewed Motion for Release on Bail under seal.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor, New York, New York 10022
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team plans to file a Renewed Motion for Release on Bail, citing new information and sureties not available at the initial hearing.
The defense seeks to file portions of the motion under seal to protect the identities of sureties (family and friends), their personal details, and Maxwell's financial records from 2015-2020.
The letter claims sureties have faced severe consequences, including one forced to resign as a CEO and another losing their entire professional practice, due to association with Maxwell.
The government consents to sealing names of co-signers and confidential discovery materials but does not consent to the requested in camera conference.
The document references social media posts containing violent threats against Ghislaine Maxwell, illustrating the harassment faced by her and her associates.
